mental Matters A Look Into StudentAthlete Mental Health

Blue Devils Come Up Short On National Television

The Owl House Ends with Poignant Spectacular Finale

Womens Soccer Finishes Regular Season With Win Over Wagner

CCSU Hosts Connecticut Supreme Court Hearings at Davidson Hall

By Brittany Burke

It has been reported that recently named captain of the mens Central Connecticut State University basketball team Ken Horton has been arrested PERIOD

In a story posted by The Hartford Courant it was reported that the arrest for breach of peace on Friday was the result of an alleged altercation that took place on Thursday PERIOD

Horton  was the only CCSU athlete involved in the altercation as confirmed by the CCSU Sports Information Director Tom Pincince PERIOD

Pincince was able to confirm this but little else PERIOD We are aware of the situation and are currently in the fact finding process PERIOD  When all of the facts are gathered we will handle the matter appropriately said Pincince in a statement on behalf of the CCSU athletics department PERIOD

The senior was named captain of the  mens basketball team by head coach Howie Dickenman in July after a standout junior season PERIOD

The 6foot6 forward led the team in freethrows with  and threes with  PERIOD He posted multiple careerhighs ending the  season with  points  rebounds  steals and  rebounds PERIOD He is the current Northeast Conference player of the year and was regarded as one of the most valuable players in the nation by SI.com writer Luke Winn PERIOD

With the basketball season beginning on Nov PERIOD  in the Connecticut  Classic it is still unclear what actions will be taken PERIOD

The CCSU athletics department has no further comment at this time according to Pincince PERIOD

The Recorder

The Student News Site of Central Connecticut State University
